\SetSymbolFont{stmry}{bold}{U}{stmry}{m}{n}
\usepackage{mathtools}
\usepackage{cancel}

\newcommand{\Parsep}{\rule{6cm}{0.4pt}}
\newcommand{\tab}{\hspace{0.5cm}}
\newcommand{\rv}{\mathbf{r}}
\newcommand{\Fv}{\mathbf{F}}
\newcommand{\pv}{\mathbf{p}}
\newcommand{\Lv}{\mathbf{L}}
\newcommand{\tauv}{\boldsymbol{\tau}}
\newcommand{\rhov}{\boldsymbol{\rho}}
\newcommand{\lambdav}{\boldsymbol{\lambda}}
\newcommand{\qv}{\mathbf{q}}
\newcommand{\vv}{\mathbf{v}}
\newcommand{\uv}{\mathbf{u}}
\newcommand{\zv}{\mathbf{0}}
\newcommand{\ev}{\mathbf{e}}
\newcommand{\nv}{\mathbf{n}}
\newcommand{\xv}{\mathbf{x}}
\newcommand{\omegav}{\boldsymbol{\omega}}
\newcommand{\const}{\text{const.}}
\newcommand{\wrt}{\text{ w.r.t }}
\newcommand{\alphav}{\boldsymbol{\alpha}}

\begin{document}
\include{stylefile}

\underline{Newton} $\Fv = m \ddot \rv = \dot \pv$ \tab
\underline{Work}: $W = \int_{\rv_1}^{\rv_2} \Fv \cdot d\rv = T(t_2) - T(t_1)$ \tab
\underline{Strong N3}: $\Fv_{12} || \left( \rv_1 - \rv_2 \right)$

\underline{Angular}: $\Lv = \rv \wedge \pv$ \tab
$\tauv = \rv \wedge \Fv = \dot \Lv$ (Origin) (Vanishes if $\Fv || \rv$)

\underline{Kepler}: $V(\rv) = -\frac{\kappa}{r}$ \tab $\Fv = - \nabla V = \left( -\frac{\kappa}{r^3} \right) \rv$ \tab

\Parsep

\underline{Principle of Least Action}: $S \left( \qv (t)  \right) \coloneqq \int_{t_1}^{t_2} L\left( \qv(t), \dot \qv(t),t \right) dt$ \tab
$L \coloneqq T-V$

$\frac{\partial}{\partial \epsilon} S \left[ \qv (t) + \epsilon \uv(t)  \right]|_{\epsilon = 0} = 0 \Longrightarrow$\underline{
$
\frac{d}{dt}\left( \frac{\partial L}{\partial \dot \qv} \right) - \frac{\partial L}{\partial \qv} = \zv \text{ (LE)}
$
}

$L_2 \left( \qv, \dot \qv, t \right) = L_1 \left( \qv, \dot \qv, t \right) + \frac{d}{dt} f\left( \qv, t \right) \Longrightarrow S_2 = S_1 + f\left( \qv^{(2)},t \right) - f \left( \qv^{(1)},t \right)$

\underline{Invar under Coord Change}: Let $\qv = \qv\left( \tilde \qv,t \right)$, $\tilde L\left( \tilde \qv, \dot{\tilde{\qv}}, t \right) \equiv L\left( \qv \left( \tilde{\qv},t \right), \dot \qv \left( \tilde{\qv}, \dot{\tilde{\qv}},t  \right), t \right)$
Note $\dot {q_a} = \sum_{b=1}^n \frac{\partial q_a}{\partial \tilde{q_b}} \dot{\tilde{q_b}} + \frac{\partial q_a}{\partial t}$
Then $\frac{d}{dt} \left( \frac{\partial \tilde L}{\partial \dot{\tilde{q_a}}} \right) - \frac{\partial \tilde L}{\partial \tilde{q_a}} = \sum_{b=1}^{n} \left[ \frac{d}{dt} \left( \frac{\partial L}{\partial \dot{q_b}} \right) - \frac{\partial L}{\partial q_b} \right]\frac{\partial q_b}{\partial \tilde{q_a}}$

\underline{Holonomic Constraints}: Constraint: $f_A(\xv,t) = 0$, $\hat L\left( \xv, \dot \xv, \lambdav , t \right) = L_0 \left( \xv, \dot \xv, t \right) + \sum_{A=1}^{d-n}\lambda_A f_A (\xv,t)$

$\frac{d}{dt}\left( \frac{\partial L_0}{\partial \dot{x_i}} \right) - \frac{\partial L_0}{\partial x_i} = \sum_{A=1}^{d-n} \lambda_A \frac{\partial f_A}{\partial x_i}$ for $i=1,\cdots,d$ \tab
$f_a(\xv,t) = 0$ for $A = 1,\cdots,d-n$

\Parsep

\textbf{Noether \& Symmetry}

$\frac{\partial}{\partial \epsilon} L \left( \qv(t) + \epsilon \uv (t), \dot \qv + \epsilon \dot \uv (t), t \right) |_{\epsilon = 0} = \frac{d}{dt} f\left( \qv(t) \dot \qv(t), t \right)$ \tab
($\rhov \left( \qv (t), \dot \qv(t), t \right) = \uv (t)$ Generator)

$\Longrightarrow F \coloneqq \sum_{a = 1}^{n} \frac{\partial L}{\partial \dot{q_a}} \rho_a - f$ conserved \tab
($\dot F \equiv 0$)

\underline{Time-translation} $\frac{\partial L}{\partial t} = 0 \stackrel{\rhov = \dot \qv, f=L}\Longrightarrow
\frac{\partial}{\partial \epsilon}\left( \cdot \right) |_{\epsilon = 0} = \frac{d}{dt}L \Longrightarrow
H \coloneqq \sum_{a=1}^{n} \frac{\partial L}{\partial \dot{q_a}}\dot{q_a} - L
$ conserved

\underline{Ignorable Coords} $\frac{\partial L}{\partial q_i} = 0 \stackrel{\rhov = \ev_i, f \equiv 0}{\Longrightarrow}
p_i \coloneqq \frac{\partial L}{\partial \dot{q_i}}
$ conserved

\underline{Rota. Invar.} $\rv \rightarrow R \rv$ ($R = I + \epsilon \Omega + O(\epsilon^2)$)
$\Longrightarrow \rv \rightarrow \rv + \epsilon \nv \wedge \rv \Longrightarrow
\Lv$ conserved

\Parsep

Oscillation: $\Fv \coloneqq -\frac{\partial V}{\partial \qv}$, 
$T_{\text{quad}} = \frac{1}{2}\sum_{a,b} T_{ab}{(\zv)} \dot{q_a}\dot{q_b} + O(q^3)$,
$V_{\text{quad}} = \cancel{V(\zv)} + \frac{1}{2} \sum_{a,b} V_{q_a q_b}(\zv) q_a q_b + O(q^3)$

Critical Point: $\Fv = 0 \Longleftrightarrow V_{\qv} = \zv$ \tab \tab
$L_{\text{quad}} = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{a,b=1}^n \mathcal{T}_{ab} \dot{q_a}\dot{q_b} - \frac{1}{2} \sum_{a,b=1}^n \mathcal{V}_{ab}q_a q_b$

\underline{Quad EL}: $\Longrightarrow \frac{d}{dt} \frac{\partial L}{\partial \dot q^a} - \frac{\partial L}{\partial q^a} = \sum_b \frac{d}{dt} \left( T_{ab} \dot q^b \right) - \sum_{b,c}\frac{\partial T_{bc}}{\partial q^a} \dot q^b \dot q^c + \frac{\partial V}{\partial q^a}
\iff \sum_b \mathcal{T}_{ab} \ddot q_b = -\sum_b \mathcal{V}_{ab} q_b
$

$\iff \mathcal{T} \ddot \qv = -\mathcal{V} \qv
\iff \ddot \qv = -\mathcal{T}^{-1} \mathcal{V} \qv \stackrel{\qv(t)=f(t) \alphav}{\Longrightarrow} \cdots
$


$\mathcal{T},\mathcal{V}$: $T = \frac{1}{2} \dot{\qv}^T \mathcal{T} \dot{\qv}$ \tab $\mathcal{V} = \frac{1}{2} \qv^T \mathcal{V} \qv$ \tab \tab

\underline{Char Equ}: $\det{(\lambda \mathcal{T} - \mathcal{V})} = 0 \Longrightarrow \lambda > 0$ (stable), $\lambda <0$ (unstable) \tab
$\omega = \sqrt{\lambda}$,
$\mathbb{\alpha} \in \ker{(\lambda \mathcal{T} - \mathcal{V})}$

\Parsep

\textbf{Rigid Body}
Coriolis: $\hat D \rv = D \rv + \omegav \wedge \rv \stackrel{\text{Fixed in S}} = \omegav \wedge \rv$

$\hat{\mathbf{a}} = {\hat{D}}^2 \left( \rv + \xv \right) = \mathbf{a} + \left( D \omegav \right) \wedge \rv + 2 \omegav \wedge D \rv + \omegav \wedge \left( \omegav \wedge \rv \right) + \mathbf{A}$ \tab
($\xv$: pos of $O$ from $\hat O$, $\mathbf{A} = {\hat{D}}^2 \xv$)

$\vv = \hat D \left( \rv + \xv \right) = \omegav \wedge \rv + \vv_O$ \tab
$M = \int_R \rho dV$ \tab
$\rv_G = \frac{1}{M} \int_R \rv \rho\left( \rv \right)dV$

$\mathbf{P} = \int_R \rho \vv dV = \int_R \rho \left( \rv \right) \left( \omegav \wedge \rv + \vv_O \right) dV \stackrel{\text{if } O = G}{=}
\int_R \rho\left( \rv \right) \vv_G dV = M \vv_G$

About $\rv_G$, $\Lv = \int_R \rho \left( \rv \right) \rv \wedge \left( \omegav \wedge \rv \right) dV$ \tab
$\Lv = \mathcal{I} \omegav$ \tab
$\mathcal{I}_{ij} = \int_R \rho\left( \rv \right)\left( \rv \cdot \rv \delta_{ij} - r_i r_j \right) dV$

$\mathcal{I} = \int_R \rho \left( \rv \right)
\begin{pmatrix}
y^2 + z^2 & -xy & -zx \\
-xy & x^2 + z^2 & -yz \\
-zx & -yz & x^2 + y^2
\end{pmatrix}
dV
$

Parallel Axis Thrm: $\mathcal{I}_{ij}^{(Q)} = \mathcal{I}_{ij}^{(G)} + M\left( \left( \mathbf{c} \cdot \mathbf{c} \right)\delta_{ij} - c_i c_j \right)$ where $\mathbf{c} = \overrightarrow{GQ}$

$T = \frac{1}{2} M {|\vv_G|}^2 + \frac{1}{2} \omegav \cdot \Lv$ (Note $\frac{1}{2} \omegav \cdot \Lv = \frac{1}{2}\sum_{i=1}^3 I_i \omega_i^2$) \tab $\dot \ev_i = \omegav \wedge \ev_i$

$\Lv = \sum_{i=1}^3 I_i \omega_i \ev_i$ \tab ($\ev_i$ axis of inertia)

No external force, torque: $\dot \Lv = \zv \Longrightarrow$ (Euler Equ)
$
\begin{cases}
I_1 \dot \omega_1 - \left( I_2 - I_3 \right) \omega_2 \omega_3 = 0 \\
I_2 \dot \omega_2 - \left( I_3 - I_1 \right) \omega_3 \omega_1 = 0 \\
I_3 \dot \omega_3 - \left( I_1 - I_2 \right) \omega_1 \omega_2 = 0 
\end{cases}
$

$
\begin{cases}
T = \frac{1}{2}\sum_{i=1}^3 I_i \omega_i^2 \equiv \const \\
\Lv \cdot \Lv = L^2 = \sum_{i=1}^3 I_i^2 \omega_i^2 \equiv \const
\end{cases}
\stackrel{\omega_2 = f(\omega_1), \omega_3 = g(\omega_1)}{\Longrightarrow}
\begin{cases}
	2I_3 T - L^2 = I_1 \left( I_3 - I_1 \right)\omega_1^2 + I_2 (I_3 - I_2) \omega_2^2 \\
	2I_2 T - L^2 = I_1 \left( I_2 - I_1 \right)\omega_1^2 + I_3 (I_2 - I_1) \omega_3^2 \\
	I_1^2 \dot \omega_1^2 = \left( I_2 - I_3 \right)^2 \omega_2^2 \omega_3^2
\end{cases}
$

\Parsep

\underline{Euler Angle Rep of $\omegav$}
$
=
\begin{pmatrix}
\dot \theta \sin{\psi} - \dot \varphi \sin{\theta} \cos{\psi} \\
\dot \theta \cos{\psi} + \dot \varphi \sin{\theta} \sin{\psi} \\
\dot \psi + \dot \varphi \cos{\theta}
\end{pmatrix}
=
\begin{pmatrix}
\omega_1 \\
\omega_2 \\
\omega_3
\end{pmatrix}
$

Rigid Body

$T = \frac{1}{2}M(\dot x^2 + \dot y^2 + \dot z^2)
+ \frac{1}{2} I_1 \omega_1^2 + \frac{1}{2}I_2 \omega_2^2
+ \frac{1}{2} I_3 \omega_3^2
$
\tab
($I_1, I_2, I_3$ w.r.t $G$)
\tab
$\vv_G = (\dot x, \dot y, \dot z)$

$V = \int_R \rho\left( \rv \right) gz dV = MG z_G$

Lagrange Top:
$T = \frac{1}{2} I_1 \omega_1^2 + \frac{1}{2}I_2 \omega_2^2 + \frac{1}{2} I_3 \omega_3^2$ \tab
($I_1, I_2, I_3$ w.r.t $G$) \tab
$\vv_O = \zv$ \tab
$V = MGl \cos{\theta}$

\Parsep

\textbf{Hamiltonian Mechanics} Legendre Transform: $g(s) \coloneqq s x(s) - f\left( x(s) \right)$

Lagrange to Hamiltonian: $L \wrt \dot \qv \stackrel{LT}{\Longrightarrow}
H(\qv,\pv,t) = \sum_{a=1}^n p_a \dot q_a -L(\qv, \dot \qv, t) |_{\dot \qv = \dot \qv \left( \qv, \pv, t \right)}
$

Hamiltonian Equation (I): $\dot \pv = -H_{\qv}$ \tab $\dot \qv = H_{\pv}$

$\frac{d}{dt}f = \sum_{a=1}^{n} \left( f_{q_a}\dot q_a + f_{p_a} \dot p_a \right) + f_t
\stackrel{\text{Hamiltonian Equ}}{\Longrightarrow}
\sum_{a=1}^{n}\left( f_{q_a} H_{p_{a}} - f_{p_a}H_{q_a} \right) + f_t = \left\{ f,H \right\} + \frac{\partial f}{\partial t}
$

Hamiltonian Equation (II): $\dot p_a = \left\{ p_a,H \right\} = -H_{q_a}$ \tab $\dot q_a = \left\{ q_a,H \right\} = H_{p_a}$

Canonical: $\left\{ q_a, q_b \right\} = 0 = \left\{ p_a, p_b \right\}$ \tab \tab $\left\{ q_a, p_b \right\} = \delta_{ab}$

\underline{Poisson's Thrm}: $\dot f = 0 = \dot g \Longrightarrow \frac{d}{dt}\left\{ f,g \right\} = 0$

$\Lv = \rv \wedge \pv \Longrightarrow L_i = \sum_{j,k} \epsilon_{ijk} x_j p_k$,
$\left\{ L_i, x_j \right\} = \sum_k \epsilon_{ijk}x_k$,
$\left\{ L_i, p_j \right\} = \sum_k \epsilon_{ijk}p_k$,
$\left\{ L_i, L_j \right\} = \sum_k \epsilon_{ijk} L_k$

$\Omega \coloneqq
\begin{pmatrix}
	0, \mathbb{I} \\
	-\mathbb{I}, 0
\end{pmatrix}
\Longrightarrow
\left\{ f,g \right\} = \sum_{\alpha,\beta = 1}^{2n} f_{y_\alpha} \Omega_{\alpha \beta} g_{y_\beta}
$ \tab
$\mathbf{y} = \left( q_1, \cdots, q_n, p_1, \cdots, p_n \right)$

\underline{Canonical Invar}

$\left\{ f,g \right\}_{y} = \left\{ f,g \right\}_{Y} \iff
\Omega_{\alpha \beta} = \sum_{\gamma, \delta = 1}^{2n} \left( Y_{\alpha} \right)_{y_\gamma} \Omega_{\gamma \delta} \left( Y_\beta \right)_{y_\delta} \iff
\Omega = \mathcal{J} \Omega \mathcal{J}^T$ \tab 

($\mathcal{J}_{\alpha \beta} = \frac{\partial Y_\alpha}{\partial y_\beta}$, $\mathcal{J} = \begin{pmatrix}
		\left( Q_a \right)_{q_b} & \left( Q_a \right)_{p_b} \\
		\left( P_a \right)_{q_b} & \left( P_a \right)_{p_b}
\end{pmatrix}$)

$
\Omega = 
\begin{pmatrix}
	\left\{ Q_a, Q_b \right\} & \left\{ Q_a, P_b \right\} \\
	\left\{ P_a, Q_b \right\} & \left\{ P_a, P_b \right\}
\end{pmatrix}
$
$\iff$ preserves canonical Poisson bracket (ie $\left\{ y_\alpha, y_\beta \right\} = \Omega_{\alpha \beta}$)

\underline{Hamiltonian VF} $\mathcal{D}_f g\coloneqq \left\{ f,g \right\}$
\tab
$\left[ \mathcal{D}_f, \mathcal{D}_g \right] \coloneqq
\mathcal{D}_f \mathcal{D}_g - \mathcal{D}_g \mathcal{D}_f = \mathcal{D}_{ \left\{ f,g \right\}}$

$\mathbf{Y} ( \mathbf{y},s) = e^{-s \mathcal{D}_f} \mathbf{y} = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty}\frac{ \left( -s \right)^{n}}{n!}\left( \mathcal{D}_f \right)^{n} \mathbf{y}$ is canonical transformation.

Generating func (1\textsuperscript{st} kind): $\sum_{a=1}^n P_a d Q_a - K dt =
\sum_{a=1}^n p_a dq_a - H dt - dF_1(\qv, \mathbf{Q}, t)$ \tab $H,K$ Hamiltonian w.r.t. $(\qv,\pv)$ and $(\mathbf{Q}, \mathbf{P})$
$\iff \pv = \frac{\partial F}{\partial \qv}$ \tab
$\mathbf{P} = -\frac{\partial F_1}{\partial \mathbf{Q}}$ \tab
$K = H + \frac{\partial F_1}{\partial t}$

\underline{Liouville}: $\text{vol} \left( V \right) = \int_V d\qv d\pv = \int d \mathbf{Q} d \mathbf{P} |\det \mathcal{J}| \Longrightarrow$
Volume invar under Hamiltonian evolution

Hamiltonian-Jacobi Equation: $\frac{\partial S}{\partial \qv} \leftarrow \pv$,
$\frac{\partial S}{\partial t} + H\left( \qv, \frac{\partial S}{\partial \qv}, t \right) = 0 \Longrightarrow$ sol: $\pv = \frac{\partial S}{\partial \qv}$, use Ham. equ

Sep of var: $H$ in $t$ indep: $S(\qv,t) = S(\qv) - E(t)$
\tab
HJ with $q_i, S_{q_i}$ in grouping $f(q_i, S_{q_i}) \Rightarrow S\left( \qv,t \right) = S_1(q_1) + S_2 (q_2, \cdots, q_n, t)$

\Parsep

\textbf{Appendix}

$\int_0^{2\pi} \sin^2{x} dx = \pi = \int_0^{2\pi} \cos^2{x} dx$

Polar Coord: $\rv = r \ev_r$ \tab
$\dot \ev_r = \dot \theta \ev_\theta$ \tab
$\dot \ev_\theta = -\dot \theta \ev_r$ \tab
$\dot \rv = \dot r \ev_r + r \dot \theta \ev_\theta$

$\ddot \rv = \left( \ddot r - r \dot \theta^2 \right) \ev_r + \frac{1}{r}\frac{d}{dt}\left( r^2 \dot \theta \right)\ev_\theta$

Uniform Disk: $I_1 = \frac{Ma^2}{4} = I_2$, $I_3 = \frac{Ma^2}{2}$ \tab
Uniform Rod: $I_1 = \frac{L^2M}{12} = I_2$, $I_3 = 0$

$\dot q_a= \const \Longrightarrow \exists \text{ frame s.t. } q_a=0$ by Galilean boost.

Spherical Coord: $(x,y,z) = \left( r \cos \varphi \sin \theta, r \sin \varphi \sin \theta, r \cos \theta \right)$

\end{document}
